Event.name: Imprisonment
Event.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Authorities</fen> put a <fen>Prisoner</fen> in <fen>Prison</fen> as punishment for an <fen>Offense</fen>.
<ex><fex name="pri">US Drug Researcher</fex> <t>Imprisoned</t> <fex name="off">for FDA Fraud</fex>.</ex> <ex>Men will be more likely to be <t>put</t> <t>away</t> <fex name="con">for murder rather than manslaughter</fex> <fex name="off">for killing their wives</fex>.</ex> <ex>However, any treatments may be years in the future and in the meantime, <fex name="pri">criminals</fex> will continue to be <t>imprisoned</t> <fex name="pur">for public safety</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="aut">The government</fex> wrongfully <t>imprisoned</t> <fex name="pri">them</fex> <fex name="jai">in ?detention centers?</fex> (a nice term for concentration camps), tortured them mentally and physically</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Prisoner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person who is confined in a penal institution.
<ex><fex name="pri">Man</fex> Falsely <t>Imprisoned</t> for 24 Years Seeks Damages</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Prison
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Prison</fen> within which the <fen>Prisoner</fen> comes to be confined. </def-root>

Arg.name: Authorities
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Authorities</fen> are the institution or actors carrying out the imprisonment.
<ex> When she returned, <fex name="aut">the Chaoyang Town government authorities</fex> <t>imprisoned</t> her for 5 days.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Offense
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Prisoner</fen> is being punished for.
<ex>After all, Dowdy was not <t>imprisoned</t> <fex name="off">for taking a bribe or even thinking about taking a bribe, but rather for committing perjury against two government witnesses who themselves eventually were imprisoned for defrauding the government</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Prisoner</fen> is kept. </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The purpose of the imprisonment.
<ex>City officials later release the blacks and say they <t>imprisoned</t> them <fex name="pur">in order to protect them from rioters</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Authorities</fen> that brings about the imprisonment.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the imprisoning event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Authorities</fen> that affect the action (<ment>ruthlessly</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The act or state of affairs that the <fen>Authorities</fen> respond to by imprisoning the <fen>Prisoner</fen>.
<ex>Though both of my grandparents were born in Canada and grew up speaking English and never had been to Japan, during the Second World War, the Canadian government <t>imprisoned</t> them <fex name="Explanation">because of their Japanese genes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of time for which the <fen>Authorities</fen> maintains the confinement of the <fen>Prisoner</fen>.
<ex>Enforcement officers caught up with Irma and <t>imprisoned</t> her <fex name="dur">for two weeks</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Conviction
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The legal classification which characterizes the <fen>Offense</fen>.
<ex>Alf leader is <t>Imprisoned</t> <fex name="con">for Arson and Burglary</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Iterations</fen> marks expressions that indicate the number of times the <fen>Prisoner</fen> was imprisoned.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: imprison.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put or keep in prison

lexUnit.name: imprisonment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of confining, or the state of being confined or confining

lexUnit.name: put away.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: confine someone in a prison

lexUnit.name: incarceration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of putting (a criminal) in prison.

lexUnit.name: time.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the period in which one must remain incarcarated for an offense.

lexUnit.name: life.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a prisoner is sentenced to spend the remainder of their natural life incarcarated; occurs with a limited set of collocational verbs (e.g. do, serve, etc.)
